snippet: The Ukrainian authorities said that former President Viktor F. Yanukovych and Russian security forces had been involved in plans that led to more than 100 deaths.
abstract: Ukrainian authorities call for arrest of former Pres Viktor F Yanukovych, charging him with mass murder in connection with deaths of more than 100 demonstrators in days immediately before the downfall of his government; accusation carries strong political message for Moscow, which has maintained that Yanukovych remains Ukraine's legitimate leader; Yanukovych denies any involvement in the shootings.

byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn and Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The Ukrainian authorities said that former President Viktor F. Yanukovych and Russian security forces had been involved in plans that led to more than 100 deaths.

headline.main: Ukraine Implicates Ex-President and Russia in Protesters’ Deaths
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Implicates Ex-President and Russia in Protesters’ Deaths
